translated: smells, ja; for separating, sa; for killing, ha; for paralyzing the mind, ru; for🔽the cold stage, na; for the hot stage, ya; for stopping water, ni; for wandering

analyzed: ra'o/_/'dir ni/_las kyi dbang gis yi ge gang dbus su gtsho bor gyur pa

analyzed: de'i gnas su yi ge ya bri bar bya'o/_/gshin rje gshed kyi 'khor lo nges pa 'di/

analyzed: de la zhi ba'i 'khor lo'i phyi rol du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyis skor cing /_re
translated: For the peaceful wheel, surround it with a moon maṇḍala outside and🔽encircle it with white silk.

original: ka dkar pos skor bar bya'o/_/rgyas pa la zla ba ser po'am/_glang po ches
analyzed: ka dkar pos skor bar bya'o/_/rgyas pa la zla ba ser po'am/_glang po ches
translated: For the increasing wheel, surround it with a yellow moon or an🔽elephant.

original: skor bar bya ste/_ji ltar glang po che'i lto bar 'khor lo tshhud par bya'o/_/
analyzed: skor bar bya ste/_ji ltar glang po che'i lto bar 'khor lo tshhud par bya'o/_/
translated: The wheel should be placed in the belly of the elephant.

original: bsad pa la gshin rje'i lto bar ro/_/bskrad pa la rnga mo'i lto bar ro/_/dbang
analyzed: bsad pa la gshin rje'i lto bar ro/_/bskrad pa la rnga mo'i lto bar ro/_/dbang
translated: For killing, it is in the belly of Yama; for banishing, in the belly of a camel;

original: du bya ba la/_btshun mo'i chos 'byung ngam/_ri dwags kyi lto bar ro/_/dgug🔽pa la seng ge'i lto bar ro/_/lkugs pa la lug gi lto bar ram/_ra'i lto bar ro//
analyzed: du bya ba la/_btshun mo'i chos 'byung ngam/_ri dwags kyi lto bar ro/_/dgug pa la seng ge'i lto bar ro/_/lkugs pa la lug gi lto bar ram/_ra'i lto bar ro//
translated: for magnetizing, in the belly of a jackal or a triangular source of phenomena;🔽for summoning, in the belly of a lion; for paralyzing, in the belly of a sheep or a goat;🔽for stopping urine, in the belly of a tortoise; for stopping semen, in the belly of a frog;

original: dri ma 'gag pa la te lo'i lto bar ro/_/mdzes thebs pa la sbal pa'i lto bar ro/_/
analyzed: dri ma 'gag pa la te lo'i lto bar ro/_/mdzes thebs pa la sbal pa'i lto bar ro/_/
translated: for stopping feces, in the belly of a cat; for stopping vomit, in the belly of a dog;🔽for stopping phlegm, in the belly of a peacock; for stopping bile, in the belly of a garuḍa;🔽for stopping pus, in the belly of a pig; for stopping blood, in the belly of a deer;

original: rims kyis thebs pa la ro langs mgo gsum lag gsum mo/_/chu 'gag pa la/
analyzed: rims kyis thebs pa la ro langs mgo gsum lag gsum mo/_/chu 'gag pa la/
translated: for stopping pain, in the belly of a snake; for stopping fever, in the belly of a three-headed, three-legged zombie; for stopping water, in the belly of a water bird;🔽for wandering, in the belly of a dog; and for all activities, in the belly of a

original: chu byi'i lto bar ro/_//'khyam pa la khyi'i lto bar ro/_/ji ltar 'khor lo lte bar
analyzed: chu byi'i lto bar ro/_//'khyam pa la khyi'i lto bar ro/_/ji ltar 'khor lo lte bar
translated: crow.

original: 'gyur/_/phyi rol gzugs kyang de bzhin bya/_/de rnams kyi mtha' rten dang bskul tshhig ni/_zhi ba'i las la mtha' rten om dang bskul tshhig shan+tim ku ru'o/_/
analyzed: 'gyur/_/phyi rol gzugs kyang de bzhin bya/_/de rnams kyi mtha' rten dang bskul tshhig ni/_zhi ba'i las la mtha' rten om dang bskul tshhig shan+tim ku ru'o/_/
translated: The final letters and the inciting letters for those are as follows: For pacifying activity, the final letter is om and the inciting letter is shantiṃ kuru.

original: de bzhin du rgyas pa la/_swa ha dang pun+ti ku ru'o/_/dbang du bya ba la/_ho
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyas pa la/_swa ha dang pun+ti ku ru'o/_/dbang du bya ba la/_ho
translated: Similarly, for enriching, it is svāhā and puṣṭiṃ kuru.🔽For magnetizing, it is hoḥ and vaśaṃ kuru.🔽For summoning, it is hriḥ, jaḥ, and akarṣaya jaḥ. For paralyzing, it is laṃ and kāya-stambhaya.

original: dang wa shing ku ru'o/_/dgug pa la hri dang dza dang a kar sha ya dza dang / rengs pa la lam dang /_ka ya ste b+ha ya'o/_/ngag rengs pa la wa ga ste pa ya ku
analyzed: dang wa shing ku ru'o/_/dgug pa la hri dang dza dang a kar sha ya dza dang / rengs pa la lam dang /_ka ya ste b+ha ya'o/_/ngag rengs pa la wa ga ste pa ya ku
translated: For paralyzing speech, it is vāk-stambhaya kuru laṃ.

original: ru lam/_'khyam pa la bra ma ra ya hum phat/_dri ma 'gag pa la/_b+hi d+ha ni ro d+ha
analyzed: ru lam/_'khyam pa la bra ma ra ya hum phat/_dri ma 'gag pa la/_b+hi d+ha ni ro d+ha
translated: For wandering, it is bhrama-mara-ya hūṃ phaṭ. For obstructing impurities, it is vidhvaṃsana-rodhaya hūṃ phaṭ.

original: ya hum phat/_mdzes thebs pa la/_kush+ti b+ha wan tu hum phat/_yid rengs pa la/
analyzed: ya hum phat/_mdzes thebs pa la/_kush+ti b+ha wan tu hum phat/_yid rengs pa la/
translated: For stunning, it is kuṣṭi-bhañjana-tu hūṃ phaṭ. For paralyzing the mind, it is mana-stambhaya hūṃ phaṭ.

original: ma na ste b+ha ya hum phat/_grang ba'i rims la/_sngo ta dza ra ya phat/_tshha ba'i
analyzed: ma na ste b+ha ya hum phat/_grang ba'i rims la/_sngo ta dza ra ya phat/_tshha ba'i
translated: For cold fever, it is śīta-jvara-ya phaṭ. For hot fever, it is jvara-mara-ya hūṃ phaṭ.

original: rims la/_u sha ma dza ra ya/_chu 'gag pa la/_mu da ni ro da ni ya hum phat/
analyzed: rims la/_u sha ma dza ra ya/_chu 'gag pa la/_mu da ni ro da ni ya hum phat/
translated: For urinary retention, say: “Mudaninirondhaya HUM Phat!”

original: 'khyam pa'am/_gdon gyis zin pa la/_pra ta gra ha na'o/_/'khor lo de
analyzed: 'khyam pa'am/_gdon gyis zin pa la/_pra ta gra ha na'o/_/'khor lo de
translated: For wandering or being possessed by demons, say: “Pratagrahanam!”🔽The ritual for consecrating those cakras is as follows:

original: rnams kyi rab tu gnas pa'i cho ga bya ba ni/_zhi ba dang rgyas pa'i 'khor lo bris
analyzed: rnams kyi rab tu gnas pa'i cho ga bya ba ni/_zhi ba dang rgyas pa'i 'khor lo bris
translated: Draw the cakras for pacifying and increasing.

original: la/_'khor lo la sogs skud pa dkar pos bcing bar bya'o/_/ji ltar
analyzed: la/_'khor lo la sogs skud pa dkar pos bcing bar bya'o/_/ji ltar
translated: Tie the cakras and so forth with white thread.

original: 'khor lo mi mthong ba'i tshhul lo/_/de bzhin du/_las kyi bye brag gis zhi ba la
analyzed: 'khor lo mi mthong ba'i tshhul lo/_/de bzhin du/_las kyi bye brag gis zhi ba la
translated: In the same way, according to the specific activity, for pacifying,

original: skud pa dkar po dang /_rgyas pa la ser po la sogs pas bcing bar bya'o/_/🔽de nas 'khor lo de rgyas pa dang zhi ba la sogs pa'i rnams la ni/_mar dang / sbrang dang /_'o mas bkang ba'i rdza phor kha sbyar du bzhag par bya'o/_/bsad
analyzed: skud pa dkar po dang /_rgyas pa la ser po la sogs pas bcing bar bya'o/_/ de nas 'khor lo de rgyas pa dang zhi ba la sogs pa'i rnams la ni/_mar dang / sbrang dang /_'o mas bkang ba'i rdza phor kha sbyar du bzhag par bya'o/_/bsad
translated: tie them with white thread, for increasing with yellow thread, and so forth.🔽Then, for the cakras of increasing, pacifying, and so forth, place them in a pair of joined clay bowls filled with butter, honey, and milk.

original: pa dang /_bskrad pa la sogs pa tshhar bcad pa'i 'khor lo rnams ni/_dug
analyzed: pa dang /_bskrad pa la sogs pa tshhar bcad pa'i 'khor lo rnams ni/_dug
translated: For the cakras of killing, expelling, and so forth, which are to be used for harsh activities, place them in a pair of joined clay bowls filled with poison,🔽blood, and so forth.

original: gshin rje gshed nag po'i 'khor lo'i gsal byed
analyzed: gshin rje gshed nag po'i 'khor lo'i gsal byed
translated: The Clarification of the Wheel of Kṛiṣhṇayamāri🔽🔽

original: dang khrag gis bkang ba'i thod pa kha sbyar du bzhag par bya'o/_/de nas zhi ba
analyzed: dang khrag gis bkang ba'i thod pa kha sbyar du bzhag par bya'o/_/de nas zhi ba
translated: The wheel of black Yamântaka should be placed in a skull cup filled with blood.🔽Then, for the wheels of pacification and increase,

original: dang /_rgyas pa'i 'khor lo ni/_gnas gtshang zhing bkra shis pa'i khang par/
analyzed: dang /_rgyas pa'i 'khor lo ni/_gnas gtshang zhing bkra shis pa'i khang par/
translated: in a clean, auspicious house,🔽on a moist mandala or on a victory banner,

original: rlan dang bcas pa'i man+dal gyi steng ngam/_rgyal mtshhan rtshe mor bzhag par bya'o/
analyzed: rlan dang bcas pa'i man+dal gyi steng ngam/_rgyal mtshhan rtshe mor bzhag par bya'o/
translated: it should be placed.

original: bsad pa dang bskrad pa la dur khrod kyi gnas su dong brus la bzhag par bya'o/_/
analyzed: bsad pa dang bskrad pa la dur khrod kyi gnas su dong brus la bzhag par bya'o/_/
translated: For killing and expelling, it should be placed in a pit dug in a charnel ground.🔽For power and summoning, it is auspicious to bury it under a hearth.

original: dbang dang dgug pa la thab kyi 'og tu sba bar shis so/_/mnan pa dang / rmongs pa'i 'khor lo ni/_bzhi mdo 'am/_zam pa'i rdur gyi 'og tu sba bar
analyzed: dbang dang dgug pa la thab kyi 'og tu sba bar shis so/_/mnan pa dang / rmongs pa'i 'khor lo ni/_bzhi mdo 'am/_zam pa'i rdur gyi 'og tu sba bar
translated: For the wheels of suppression and confusion, it should be buried under a crossroads or a bridge.

original: bya'o/_/dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu 'di ni sngags pas rig par
analyzed: bya'o/_/dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu 'di ni sngags pas rig par
translated: The mantra practitioner should know that these are the virtuous and nonvirtuous results of karma.

original: bya'o/_/las rtshogs de rnams kyi dus kyi nges pa gsungs te/_zhi ba la snga dro
analyzed: bya'o/_/las rtshogs de rnams kyi dus kyi nges pa gsungs te/_zhi ba la snga dro
translated: The time for these collections of karma is taught: For pacification,

analyzed: dang po kha shar du bltas pas mchod par bya'o/_/rgyas pa la nyi ma phyed la byang du
translated: First, for pacifying, make offerings facing east. For increasing, make🔽offerings at noon facing north.

original: bltas te mchod do/_/dbang du bya ba ni nyi ma nub kha/_kha nub tu bltas pas
analyzed: bltas te mchod do/_/dbang du bya ba ni nyi ma nub kha/_kha nub tu bltas pas
translated: For enthralling, make offerings at sunset facing west.🔽For killing and so forth, practice through the door of facing south at

original: so/_/bsad pa la sogs pa ni/_mtshhan phyed na kha lhor bltas pa'i sgo nas🔽sgrub par bya'o/_/zhi ba dang /_rgyas pa la ni sna bug g.yon nas rlung rgyu ba'i
analyzed: so/_/bsad pa la sogs pa ni/_mtshhan phyed na kha lhor bltas pa'i sgo nas sgrub par bya'o/_/zhi ba dang /_rgyas pa la ni sna bug g.yon nas rlung rgyu ba'i
translated: midnight.🔽For pacifying and increasing, do it when the wind moves through the🔽left nostril.🔽For killing and expelling, do it when the wind moves through the right

original: dus su'o/_/bsad pa dang /_bskrad pa la ni/_sna bug g.yas nas rlung rgyu
analyzed: dus su'o/_/bsad pa dang /_bskrad pa la ni/_sna bug g.yas nas rlung rgyu
translated: nostril.

original: ba'i dus su bya'o/_/de bzhin du bsad pa la ni/_lha zhe sdang gshin rje gshed🔽kyis so/_/zhi ba la/_gti mug gshin rje gshed kyis so/_/rgyas pa la/_phra
analyzed: ba'i dus su bya'o/_/de bzhin du bsad pa la ni/_lha zhe sdang gshin rje gshed kyis so/_/zhi ba la/_gti mug gshin rje gshed kyis so/_/rgyas pa la/_phra
translated: Similarly, for killing, do it with the deity of anger, Yamantaka. For🔽pacifying, do it with the deity of stupidity, Yamantaka. For increasing, do it🔽with the deity of avarice, Yamantaka. For paralyzing, do it with the deity of

analyzed: ma gshin rje gshed kyis so/_/rengs pa la/_phrag dog gshin rje gshed kyis
translated: envy, Yamantaka.🔽Similarly, for expelling and so forth, do it with the deity of pride,

original: bya'o/_/de bzhin du bskrad pa la sogs pa la/_tho ba gshin rje gshed la sogs
analyzed: bya'o/_/de bzhin du bskrad pa la sogs pa la/_tho ba gshin rje gshed la sogs
translated: Vajrapani.

original: pa'i lha rnams shes par bya'o/_/yang na/_las thams cad pa la phrag dog gshin
analyzed: pa'i lha rnams shes par bya'o/_/yang na/_las thams cad pa la phrag dog gshin
translated: The deities of the other activities should be understood in the same way.

original: rje gshed kyis bya'o/_/'khor lo'i cho ga gsal bar byed pa'i/_de kho na nyid
analyzed: rje gshed kyis bya'o/_/'khor lo'i cho ga gsal bar byed pa'i/_de kho na nyid
translated: Alternatively, for all activities, one should use the jealous Yama Yamāri.🔽This concludes the Compendium of Principles,

original: bsdus pa/_bsod snyoms pa b+hud+ha shri dz+nya nas mdzad pa rdzogs so//_//🔽rgya gar gyi pan+di ta d+hi pam ka ra shri dz+nya na dang /_lotsh+tshha ba tshhul khrims rgyal bas
analyzed: bsdus pa/_bsod snyoms pa b+hud+ha shri dz+nya nas mdzad pa rdzogs so//_// rgya gar gyi pan+di ta d+hi pam ka ra shri dz+nya na dang /_lotsh+tshha ba tshhul khrims rgyal bas
translated: which illuminates the rites of the wheel, composed by the alms-begging Bhusuku.🔽It was translated by the Indian paṇḍita Dharmākara Śrī Jñāna and the editor Lotsāwa Tsultrim Gyalwa.

analyzed: bsgyur ba las/_dus phyis dge slong rdo rje grags kyis bcos pa'o//_/zhi/_/
translated: Later, it was revised by the monk Dorjé Trak.🔽May there be auspiciousness!

original: ma ma/_skal _ba_ba_ba_ra_ _/_dngas 'tshher po/_da /ra/_/lta ba lo/
analyzed: ma ma/_skal _ba_ba_ba_ra_ _/_dngas 'tshher po/_da /ra/_/lta ba lo/
translated: May there be an abundance of prosperity!🔽The view is pure.

original: ba _ka dag cho ga      shag   _   brjod kyi ya ku ru ka gas pa las bzla//
analyzed: ba _ka dag cho ga      shag   _   brjod kyi ya ku ru ka gas pa las bzla//
translated: The ritual of the primordial purity is complete.
